title: Typefaces in british GQ and W
content:
Anyone who know’s what typefaces (sans, serif & slab) are used for the magazine W, aswell as for the brittish edition of GQ (sans & a hard-edged headline-version-sans).

 [‹ (x) "Kim's Salon" similar to Monotype Corsiva - ITC Zapf Chancery {Nick Curtis}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122005628/http:/typophile.com/node/18517 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Trading pty ltd" western-style block face - Playbill {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122005628/http:/typophile.com/node/18521 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Eigil Zetter

comments.content: Could you please scan the relevant pages and post them, so we can see what we need to identify? Thx! :^)

BTW GQ is known to be using [Foundry Gridnik](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122005628/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4724) and [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122005628/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html) on its cover, and [FB Titling Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122005628/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18001) as — you guessed it — headline face.
